vn.loitp.views.overscroll.lib.overscroll

Class OverScrollBounceEffectDecoratorBase.OverScrollingState

  • java.lang.Object
    • vn.loitp.views.overscroll.lib.overscroll.OverScrollBounceEffectDecoratorBase.OverScrollingState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OverScrollBounceEffectDecoratorBase.IDecoratorState
    Enclosing class:
    OverScrollBounceEffectDecoratorBase

    protected class OverScrollBounceEffectDecoratorBase.OverScrollingState
extends java.lang.Object
implements OverScrollBounceEffectDecoratorBase.IDecoratorState
    Handles the actual over-scrolling: thus translating the view according to configuration and user interactions, dynamically.



    The state is exited - thus completing over-scroll handling, in one of two cases:
    When user lets go of the view, it transitions control to the bounce-back state.
    When user moves the view back onto a potential 'under-scroll' state, it abruptly transitions control to the idle-state, so as to return touch-events management to the normal over-scroll-less environment (thus preventing under-scrolling and potentially regaining regular scrolling).
